results.name: a(n) = ((n+1)^(n-1)-1)/n.
comment: a(n) is prime for n = {3,4,6,74,...}; prime terms are {5, 31, 2801, ...}.
a(n) is the (n-1)-th generalized repunit in base (n+1). For example, a(5) = 259 which is 1111 in base 6. - _Mathew Englander_, Oct 20 2020
maple: a:=n->sum((n+3)^j, j=0..n): seq(a(n), n=-1..17); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 17 2008
program: (Sage) [gaussian_binomial(n,1,n+2) for n in range(0,18)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 31 2009
xref: Cf. other sequences of generalized repunits, such as A125118, A053696, A055129, A060072, A031973, A173468, A023037, A119598, A085104, and A162861.
